required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Evaluating the Pharmacokinetics of Keppra Extended Release (XR) in Children and Adults With Epilepsy
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Multicenter, Parallel-Group, Two-Arm Study Comparing the Pharmacokinetics of Keppra XR in Children (Aged 12 - 16 Years Old) With Epilepsy and in Adults (Aged 18 - 55 Years Old) With Epilepsy

brief_summary.textblock: To study how the body absorbs, distributes, metabolises and eliminates Keppra XR in both children (12 to 16 years old) and adults (18 to 55 years old) with epilepsy.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Concentration at Steady State (Cmax) of Keppra XR Normalized by Dose and by Body Weight and Dose During up to 7 Days of Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 pharmacokinetic samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration.
primary_outcome.description: The Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration normalized by dose and by body weight and dose. Cmax normalized by 1000 mg dose was calculated as: Cmax/(mg dose taken/ 1000 mg Keppra XR). Cmax normalized by body weight and dose (1 mg Keppra XR/kg) was calculated as: Cmax/(bodyweight (kg)/ mg dose Keppra XR taken). Pharmacokonetic (PK) samples were taken predose and 1h, 2.5h, 4h, 6h and 10h after study medication at day 4, 5, 6 or 7 of Keppra XR administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve Over a Dosing Interval of 24 Hours (AUCtau) of Keppra XR Normalized by Dose, and by Body Weight and Dose During up to 7 Days of Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 pharmacokinetic samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration.
primary_outcome.description: AUCtau normalized by 1000 mg dose was calculated as: AUCtau/(mg dose taken/ 1000 mg Keppra XR). AUCtau normalized by body weight and dose (1 mg Keppra XR/kg) was calculated as: AUCtau/(bodyweight (kg)/ mg dose Keppra XR taken). 6 PK samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration. At steady state, reached after 2 days of administration of Keppra XR, the concentrations at 24h postdose is equal to the predose concentration. The predose concentration was used as the 24h concentration to calculate AUCτau.

primary_outcome.measure: Time of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Keppra XR During up to 7 Days of Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 pharmacokinetic samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration.
primary_outcome.description: The Tmax is the time corresponding to the maximum plasma concentration of Keppra XR. It was directly obtained from the observed concentration versus time curve. 6 pharmacokinetic samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Total Body Clearance (CL/F) of Keppra XR During up to 7 Days of Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 pharmacokinetic samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration.
primary_outcome.description: The Apparent Total Body Clearance (CL/F) was calculated as Dose/ AUCtau. 6 pharmacokinetic samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events From Starting Study Drug Treatment (Day 1) to up to 14 Days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Starting Study Drug Treatment (Day 1) to up to 14 days
secondary_outcome.description: An Adverse Event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a subject or clinical investigation subject administered a pharmaceutical product which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Treatment emergent means that an AE has begun or got worse after start of Keppra XR administration.

intervention.description: Keppra XR 500 mg tablets and Keppra XR 750 mg tablets Dosage: Keppra XR 1000-3000 mg/day taken once daily. Duration: 4-7 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a diagnosis of epilepsy on up to three concomitant anti-epileptic drugs
- Subjects on levetiracetam immediate release (IR) can be enrolled if on a stable dose for 7 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a history of status epilepticus within 3 months of Visit 1
- Subject has difficult venous accessibility

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population includes all enrolled patients who received at least one dose of study medication.Pharmacokinetic Per-Protocol (PK-PP) population is a subset of the ITT population, consisting of those patients who had no major protocol deviations affecting the pharmacokinetic parameters.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant Flow and Baseline characteristics refer to the Intention-to-treat (ITT) population.

group.title: Keppra XR in Children (12-16 Years Old)
group.description: Drug: Keppra XR Keppra XR 500 mg tablets and Keppra XR 750 mg tablets Dosage: Keppra XR 1000-3000 mg/day taken once daily Duration: 4-7 days

group.title: Keppra XR in Adults (18-55 Years Old)
group.description: Drug: Keppra XR Keppra XR 500 mg tablets and Keppra XR 750 mg tablets Dosage: Keppra XR 1000-3000 mg/day taken once daily Duration: 4-7 days

participants_list.participants: Two subjects were excluded due to study medication noncompliance, one due to wrong dosing regimen.

outcome.title: Maximum Concentration at Steady State (Cmax) of Keppra XR Normalized by Dose and by Body Weight and Dose During up to 7 Days of Administration
outcome.description: The Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration normalized by dose and by body weight and dose. Cmax normalized by 1000 mg dose was calculated as: Cmax/(mg dose taken/ 1000 mg Keppra XR). Cmax normalized by body weight and dose (1 mg Keppra XR/kg) was calculated as: Cmax/(bodyweight (kg)/ mg dose Keppra XR taken). Pharmacokonetic (PK) samples were taken predose and 1h, 2.5h, 4h, 6h and 10h after study medication at day 4, 5, 6 or 7 of Keppra XR administration.
outcome.time_frame: 6 pharmacokinetic samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration.

group.title: Keppra XR in Children (12-16 Years Old)
group.description: Drug: Keppra XR Keppra XR 500 mg tablets and Keppra XR 750 mg tablets Dosage: Keppra XR 1000-3000 mg/day taken once daily Duration: 4-7 days

measure.title: Maximum Concentration at Steady State (Cmax) of Keppra XR Normalized by Dose and by Body Weight and Dose During up to 7 Days of Administration
measure.description: The Cmax is the maximum plasma concentration normalized by dose and by body weight and dose. Cmax normalized by 1000 mg dose was calculated as: Cmax/(mg dose taken/ 1000 mg Keppra XR). Cmax normalized by body weight and dose (1 mg Keppra XR/kg) was calculated as: Cmax/(bodyweight (kg)/ mg dose Keppra XR taken). Pharmacokonetic (PK) samples were taken predose and 1h, 2.5h, 4h, 6h and 10h after study medication at day 4, 5, 6 or 7 of Keppra XR administration.

class.title: Dose and weight norm. ( Keppra XR 1 mg/kg)

analysis.groups_desc: An ANOVA for log-transformed values has been used as the basis for calculation of point estimates and Confidence Intervals (CIs).

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve Over a Dosing Interval of 24 Hours (AUCtau) of Keppra XR Normalized by Dose, and by Body Weight and Dose During up to 7 Days of Administration
outcome.description: AUCtau normalized by 1000 mg dose was calculated as: AUCtau/(mg dose taken/ 1000 mg Keppra XR). AUCtau normalized by body weight and dose (1 mg Keppra XR/kg) was calculated as: AUCtau/(bodyweight (kg)/ mg dose Keppra XR taken). 6 PK samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration. At steady state, reached after 2 days of administration of Keppra XR, the concentrations at 24h postdose is equal to the predose concentration. The predose concentration was used as the 24h concentration to calculate AUCτau.
outcome.time_frame: 6 pharmacokinetic samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration.

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve Over a Dosing Interval of 24 Hours (AUCtau) of Keppra XR Normalized by Dose, and by Body Weight and Dose During up to 7 Days of Administration
measure.description: AUCtau normalized by 1000 mg dose was calculated as: AUCtau/(mg dose taken/ 1000 mg Keppra XR). AUCtau normalized by body weight and dose (1 mg Keppra XR/kg) was calculated as: AUCtau/(bodyweight (kg)/ mg dose Keppra XR taken). 6 PK samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration. At steady state, reached after 2 days of administration of Keppra XR, the concentrations at 24h postdose is equal to the predose concentration. The predose concentration was used as the 24h concentration to calculate AUCτau.

class.title: Dose and weight norm. (Keppra XR 1 mg/kg)

analysis.groups_desc: An ANOVA for log-transformed values has been used as the basis for calculation of point estimates and Confidence Intervals (CIs).

outcome.title: Time of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Keppra XR During up to 7 Days of Administration
outcome.description: The Tmax is the time corresponding to the maximum plasma concentration of Keppra XR. It was directly obtained from the observed concentration versus time curve. 6 pharmacokinetic samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration.

outcome.description: The Apparent Total Body Clearance (CL/F) was calculated as Dose/ AUCtau. 6 pharmacokinetic samples were taken pre-dose, 1, 2.5, 4, 6 and 10 hours after administration, at Day 4, 5, 6, or 7 of Keppra XR administration.

outcome.title: Occurrence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events From Starting Study Drug Treatment (Day 1) to up to 14 Days
outcome.description: An Adverse Event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a subject or clinical investigation subject administered a pharmaceutical product which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Treatment emergent means that an AE has begun or got worse after start of Keppra XR administration.
outcome.time_frame: From Starting Study Drug Treatment (Day 1) to up to 14 days
outcome.population: Safety Set includes all subjects who took at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Set is identical to the Intention-to-treat (ITT) population in this study.

measure.description: An Adverse Event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence in a subject or clinical investigation subject administered a pharmaceutical product which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Treatment emergent means that an AE has begun or got worse after start of Keppra XR administration.
measure.population: Safety Set includes all subjects who took at least one dose of study medication. The Safety Set is identical to the Intention-to-treat (ITT) population in this study.

reported_events.time_frame: From Starting Study Drug Treatment (Day 1) to up to 14 days.
reported_events.desc: Treatment-Emergent AEs were collected and refer to the Safety Set. Safety Set includes all subjects who took at least one dose of study medication. Treatment emergent means that an Adverse Event has begun or got worse after start of Keppra XR administration.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: UCB has > 60 days but <= 180 days to review results communications prior to public release and may delete information that compromises ongoing studies or is considered proprietary. This restriction is not intended to compromise the objective scientific integrity of the manuscript, it being understood that results shall be published regardless of outcome.
